summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to a voluntary employee interviewee in an investigation. The form indicates the investigation pertains to 'Job Performance Failure and Security Failure' and includes signature lines for the OIG Special Agent, the employee, and a witness.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: OIG Special Agent conducting the interview
persons.context: The OIG Special Agent is the investigator obtaining the voluntary statement from the employee and whose signature is required on the form.

keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
The investigation being conducted pertains to 'Job Performance Failure and Security Failure'.
The form provides legal warnings and assurances to the employee, stating the interview is voluntary and no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer.
The form requires signatures from the OIG Special Agent, the employee, and a witness.
The form is a standard administrative document (OIG Form III-226) and does not contain specific details about the underlying investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.
